name: klaus
text: Seriously Onstad, I'd say 2005 was the best year of Achewood ever. You were just on the ball. Reading through I'm cracking up, or feeling some sort of emotion at every strip.

name: overmedicated
text: I concur.

name: saint
text: how does this comic make you feel?

name: baryonyx
text: Terrified.

name: chuchurocket
text: A comment left by chuchurocket was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by ted0phile, Norsef, riotdejaneiro, srmeowmeow, Vondicus, odei, scrumpton, HSE, Howard, NDCaesar, DougTheHead, atticusonline, Lumus, Brosaurus)

name: chuchurocket
text: A comment left by chuchurocket was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Norsef, srmeowmeow, getawaykettle, rascaldom, DougTheHead, atticusonline, Brosaurus, mattylite, Madoushi)

name: biomusicologist
text: Because it was a stretch?

name: chuchurocket
text: A comment left by chuchurocket was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Norsef, srmeowmeow, greenery, getawaykettle, ActualTaunt, atticusonline, Art-Vader, Lumus, Brosaurus, Madoushi)

name: iseedeadpixels
text: Is it terribly inappropriate to say I think chuchurocket was rad?

name: chuchurocket
text: A comment left by chuchurocket was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by srmeowmeow, mattbeetee, Brosaurus, kestral)

name: dusty
text: That's odd, usually when I give someone a chubby its a stretch.

name: karljw
text: 2004-2005 in my opinion. 2005 is funnier, but 2004 has the two best Nice Pete arcs.

name: mikeleffel2
text: The terror of small children is delightful!

name: spinynorman
text: This is TOTALLY WONDERFUL!

name: spicyponyhead
text: The terror of small otters.....divine.

name: dirtyantaeus
text: Philippe kneeled in fear.

name: thesaddesthing
text: The kneeling truly sells his terror

name: saint
text: knelt. he knelt in fear.

name: saru
text: I don't know if falling to your knees in abject terror is really the same as kneeling.

name: pogo
text: I agree, Phillipe went "weak in the knees from fear," he did not kneel voluntarily.

name: senseihollywood
text:
the horror, the horror...

[IMGS OFF]

name: andrew_
text: bar-none, my favorite achewood strip ever. This is the strip I use as a barometer for my friends and their compatability with achewood.

name: gumfish
text: Your avatar makes this comment look somewhat absurd.

name: carlyle
text: I thought that was from the Mickey Pancake, but then I didn't remember so many shock lines.

name: rowboat
text: Yes, Andrew. You should know that you are not allowed to say anything that wouldn't actually be screamed by a mortified Philippe. You are here for our amusement.

name: aliiis
text: May I suggest 'AAAA! AAAAAAAA! AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA! ', for example?

name: shutup_shutup
text: Completely.  This strip is hanging in my home, immediately next to the door to my bed room.  If someone doesn't like it, then they aren't welcome in my bed room.  It's important.

name: kingsleymc
text: "Extra stuff."  That's some quality right there.

name: untilyouaresonude
text: What's sad is that you can't tell whether LieBot is happy or sad or indifferent to the result here.

name: sargasm
text: I sort of get the impression that he isn't happy or sad, he just has a "LIE COMPLETED" message scrolling around in his programming.

name: untilyouaresonude
text: Do you know, I never thought of that. I guess he's a machine, he doesn't really put a great deal of thought behind it.

name: petitegitan
text: It is clear in this strip that Philippe does not understand the concept of a "LIE" bot.  Poor little guy.

name: dans
text: No one seems to. Maybe they've always pronounced it "Lé Bot" or something?

name: stuart
text: It's because he mixes it up. Look back through the archives, half of the time he's telling the truth.

name: spinynorman
text: I get the feeling that he's sort of thinking, "Huh. Well, wouldja look at that?"

name: baryonyx
text: I think he's just harvesting the discord caused by his disinformation.

name: drskradley
text: That's because telling the truth half the time is THE BEST KIND OF LIE

name: hcaz
text: Another interesting thing is the way that he is holding his sides as if he were laughing, but he is not laughing, just standing there in his bitching shoes, getting props from us plebs.

name: fattypneumonia
text: He maintains the pose for the entire strip.  I see him as hooking his thumbs through imaginary belt loops, or around imaginary suspenders....

name: wehavemagnums
text: a SKELETON. So perfect.

name: nurdbot
text: Oh god, the intense screaming of Phillippe reminds me of how scared I was of skeletons when I was a kid.

name: epicurus
text: I would have done this when I was about five or so.

name: gtc
text:
Very true, I remember dreaming that my dad answered the door bell to find a skeleton on the door step just standing there, watching us.

I screamed enough to wake the whole house.

name: jujubeesforjesus
text: They hang out with Lie bot so much, but they just do not even get his prime directive at all, which is in his name.

name: hollis
text: Philippe's mouth opens differently now. Compare to http://achewood.com/index.php?date=10152001

name: mrsmuckles
text: He's also gained a button nose since then.

name: greenkoolayd
text: and  2 eyes made out of coal

name: lolsworth
text: Yet it's still kind of gross.

name: chiquitabanana151
text: Oh, the terror!! Poor little guy...

name: soilentshuggah
text: The fact that he kneels in absolute mind numbing terror makes me gag with laughter.

name: cousinted
text: Teodor really needs to stop leaving Philippe alone with that robot.

name: hollis
text: The problem is, no one other animal is responsible for Philippe.  His bringing-up is so inconsistent.  Of course, that can be a good thing sometimes - lots of different influences.  And Lie Bot *did* get him eating healthy again with the whole dinosaur eggs and king piss thing...

name: fattypneumonia
text: It takes a dysfunctional village to raise a dysfunctional child.

name: tttt
text: I clicked 5 with wild abandon

name: tekende
text: Your avatar displays this perfectly.

name: pogo
text: A comment left by pogo was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by beansdooma, rascaldom, Lumus)

name: mattfish
text: Semantics is just glorified word choice.

name: pogo
text: So you say.

name: pogo
text: (I later gave up on this battle of terms, but not before the avitaricon and variations were invented.)

name: tekende
text: shutup shutup

name: rascaldom
text: The battle of the very sophisticated avatars.

name: stuart
text: He looks so adorable in Panel 4

name: deusoma
text: You get the distinct impression he's just going to keep screaming until he passes out due to lack of oxygen.

name: saru
text: Which will take about seven panels.

name: jonmw
text: I like to imagine that he's perfected the method of screaming in abject terror while breathing IN. So he keeps screaming until he hyperventilates.

name: clintisiceman
text: When I was Philippe's age, I was at this Mexican restaurant that my family goes to a lot. My dad told me that behind this decorative Mexican rug that was hanging on the wall, there was a mummy.  My reaction was pretty similar to this.

name: sp1derbaby
text: But the good news is, the whiskey works.

name: ibetso
text: Since the next seven panels also go AAAAAAAA!... I like to think that Philippe in this strip sounds a bit like the dude in the Godfather who finds a horse head in his bed.

name: kalethan
text: "A man in my position can't afford to be made to look ridiculous"

name: thalassocrat
text: AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA!

name: steerpike66
text: I'm asphyxiating. This is what...I...my...brother...when he was five...BwahHAH!

name: drskradley
text: This strip even translates well to telling it to a friend, no visuals. That's class .

name: lexsenthur
text: No child has ever felt terror like this before.

name: scorpio_nadir
text:
All children feel that terror, or they have had uninformed childhood(s).
It is the terror of Future Dead Person

name: deovalente
text: Quite possibly my favorite ever.  I would vote a 6 if I could.

name: unsentletter
text: Damn you, Lie Bot... damn you.

name: tekende
text: That door is shaped weird and would not open properly in real life.

name: tagrineth
text: How can anyone not love the Philippe vs. Lie Bot strips?

name: dasuta
text: collapsing in sheer terror...  poor Philippe.

name: tttt2
text: Philippe is too old to believe in skeletons

name: mulisha7
text: Wow, This set up really could use a "review comment before posting feature." What I meant to say is Liebot is a smug, self-satisfied, vainglorious bastard.

name: lawbot
text: Philippe here reminds me of snoopy.

name: scorpio_nadir
text: Philippe's face actually ages from terror. That's what stress does.

name: actualtaunt
text:
In my acting class, we were working with emotion, specifically fear. "think of something terrifying." I let my mind wander for a quarter of a second. Skeletons are scary, I think.
I was reprimanded for my loud and inappropriate laugher.

name: milkpants
text: this was the 1st strip i had the pleasure of coming across about 2 years ago.... i cracked up soooo hard. fan ever since.

name: atticusonline
text: [IMGS OFF]

name: lrosetw8
text: YES.

name: nice-on-water
text: INDEED.

name: atticusonline
text: FORSOOTH

name: nice-on-water
text: AAAAAAAAAAAAAA!

name: atticusonline
text: A SKELETON!!

name: nice-on-water
text: Oh, I dunno.  Extra stuff?

name: atticusonline
text: Don't worry we can keep this going. Now tell me all the anachronisms of the 13th century prostitutes in rural England.

name: nice-on-water
text: I guess that would be that they wore digital watches or some such modern device which were clearly out of place for the time?

name: atticusonline
text: It was the pads with wings...nobody had wings in the 13th century...those crazy hookers.

name: nice-on-water
text: Hookers wear feminine hygiene products?

name: atticusonline
text: The anachronistic ones do.

name: nice-on-water
text: AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA!

name: atticusonline
text: AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA!!

name: nice-on-water
text: AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA!

name: nice-on-water
text:
Oh shit wait let's make our avatars talk:

PHILLIPE DOGG LOOK AT THIS DANG OLD CHICKEN WHAT AM I SUPPOSED TO DO WITH THIS THING ARE THESE PEOPLE OFF THEIR COOKIE OR SOMETHING DOGG I MEAN REALLY AIN'T ANYONE GOT ANY SENSE ANYMORE

name: atticusonline
text: Hi, I am Philippe. Nice to meet you.

name: atticusonline
text: AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA!

name: shutup_shutup
text: Are you guys available to perform at parties?  This is pretty fantastic.

name: nice-on-water
text:
Oh yeah, yeah, we sure are...

but only if the party took place a month ago!

Car of pain etc

name: doc_rostov
text:
If only I had but one more Chubby to give.

Sixteen times.

name: atticusonline
text: A chubby for the doc.

name: atticusonline
text: Maybe we should have a reunion tour!

name: tekende
text: Well, that was weird. Anyway...

name: atticusonline
text:
Look...some things were said....some images were posted. Let's put the past behind us and try to be pals.

AAAAAAAAA!

name: nice-on-water
text: Guys I really hatAAAAAAAAAAAAA!

name: atticusonline
text: Hey I couldn't really read what you said. Did you get cut off or sometAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA!

name: nice-on-water
text: Did you mean"AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA!"?

name: philophobe
text: Whenever I see this strip, I immediately want to pair it with this strip.

name: echidnaboy
text:
You mean like this?
[IMGS OFF]

name: philophobe
text:
Fucking. Hell. Yes.

Thank you for making this poor-with-computers guy smile, smile, smile.

name: razorman57
text: the way that lie bot is in the last panel reminds me of a cold, emotionless killer.
